definition: early to bed, early to rise/to keep early hours

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Many older adults tend to get sleepier earlier in the evening and awaken earlier in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 許多老年人傾向於早睡早起。

sentences.english: You can sleep and wake up early perfectly fine by changing other habits.
sentences.chinese: 你可能通過其它的習慣早睡早起。

sentences.english: One hears about the virtues of early to bed and early to rise which supposedly inculcate wisdom and good health.
sentences.chinese: 據說早睡早起是一個有利於智力與健康的好習慣。

sentences.english: Japanese told to go to bed an hour early to cut carbon .
sentences.chinese: 日政府呼籲民衆早睡早起，減少碳排放。

definition: to stay up late or all night
to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)
to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
sleep/to sleep/(computing) to enter sleep mode
life is motion (popular saying with many possible interpretations)/Physical effort is vital for our bodies to function (Aristotle)./Life derives from physical exercise.
pinyin: sheng1 ming4 zai4 yu2 yun4 dong4

definition: to get out of bed/to get up
lit. the body is the revolution's capital/fig. good health is a prerequisite for work (Mao Zedong's saying)
pinyin: shen1 ti3 shi4 ge2 ming4 de5 ben3 qian2

definition: lit. rising and lying down, working and resting (idiom)/fig. everyday life/daily routine/to go about one's daily life
